EQUITIES

GLOBAL - Global shares declined on Thursday and were on pace for their biggest daily decline in three weeks, weighed down by large drops in megacaps Microsoft and Meta Platforms, while the dollar rose against the yen after policy announcements from the Federal Reserve and Bank of Japan.

MSCI's gauge of stocks across the globe EURONEXT:IACWI fell 5.98 points, or 0.59%, to 1,008.44 and was on track for its largest daily percentage drop since October 10.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

NEW YORK - The S&P 500 and Nasdaq dropped on Thursday, as Meta and Microsoft fell on worries over surging AI spending, rattling investors already anxious about the U.S. Federal Reserve's pace of monetary policy easing.

At 11:48 a.m., the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 190.04 points, or 0.40%, to 47,822.04, the S&P 500 lost 34.43 points, or 0.50%, to 6,855.82 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 272.88 points, or 1.14%, to 23,685.59.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

LONDON - European shares logged their third session of declines on Thursday as uncertainty over the future moves of central banks grew, while investors parsed a new raft of corporate earnings.

The pan-European STOXX 600 index fell 0.1% and most regional bourses also ended the day in the red.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

TOKYO - Japan's Nikkei share average climbed to a record high on Thursday after the Bank of Japan refrained from raising interest rates, in a volatile session that saw the benchmark index flip between gains and losses more than 20 times.

The Nikkei climbed as much as 0.6% to reach 51,620.79 for the first time, before succumbing to some profit taking. It ended the day up only 0.04%, but enough to set a new record closing level of 51,325.61.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

SHANGHAI - China shares pulled back from a decade high on Thursday as U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping concluded a high-stakes meeting in South Korea with a trade-war truce that investors had broadly expected.

The benchmark Shanghai Composite Index hit its highest level since 2015 at the start of the session but closed down 0.73%, inching away from the 10-year high it has been around this week.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

AUSTRALIA - Australian shares fell for a third straight session on Thursday, dragged by real estate and consumer discretionary stocks, with investors scaling back expectations of an interest rate cut following hotter-than-expected third-quarter inflation data.

The S&P/ASX 200 index fell 0.46% to close at 8,885.50 points, its lowest closing level since October 13. The benchmark shed nearly 1% on Wednesday.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

SEOUL - South Korean shares notched another record high on Thursday after Washington and Seoul finalized a trade deal that eased uncertainties for exporters across auto, chips and shipbuilding sectors. The won weakened, while the benchmark bond yield rose.

The benchmark KOSPI index closed up 5.74 points, or 0.14%, at 4,086.89.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

FOREIGN EXCHANGE

NEW YORK - The Japanese yen tumbled against the U.S. dollar on Thursday after the Bank of Japan adopted a less hawkish tone than traders expected, while the greenback was boosted after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday said a rate cut in December was not guaranteed.

Against the Japanese yen , the dollar strengthened 0.98% to 154.21, the highest since February 13.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

SHANGHAI - China's yuan retreated from a near one-year high against the dollar on Thursday, after U.S. President Donald Trump's long-awaited meeting with his Chinese counterpart met expectations but gave investors few new reasons for trade optimism.

The onshore yuan ended the domestic trading session at 7.1107 per dollar, down 0.16% from the previous late night close. Its offshore counterpart CNH=D3 traded at 7.11 as of 0830 GMT.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

AUSTRALIA - The Australian and New Zealand dollars edged higher on Thursday after falling overnight in the wake of the U.S. Federal Reserve's decision to push back against expectations for a rate cut in December, a move that caused the greenback to rally.

The Australian dollar rose 0.2% on Thursday to $0.6587, having fallen from a three-week high of $0.6617 overnight thanks to a hot domestic inflation report. It broke a five-day winning streak, with resistance heavy at $0.6630.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

SEOUL - The won weakened, while the benchmark bond yield rose on Thursday.

In offshore trading, the won was quoted at 1,427.9 per dollar, down 0.1% on the day, while in non-deliverable forward trading its one-month contract KRW1MNDFOR= was quoted at 1,425.6.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

TREASURIES

NEW YORK - U.S. Treasury yields continued to rise on Thursday as markets saw lower odds of another Federal Reserve interest rate cut in December and wondered about the effects of a prolonged U.S. government shutdown on monetary policy.

Early on Thursday, the yield on the benchmark U.S. 10-year Treasury note (US10YT=TWEB) rose 2.3 basis points (bps) to 4.095%, after the largest rise since June on Wednesday.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

LONDON - Traders were confident in their view that the European Central Bank would keep rates on hold for now after it left policy unchanged, flagging a more resilient economy and appearing more relaxed about the growth outlook.

Germany's rate-sensitive two-year yield (DE2YT=RR) was up 2 basis points at around 2%, benchmark 10-year Bund yields (DE10YT=RR) were also up 2 bps at 2.64%.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

TOKYO - Japan's Nikkei share average climbed to a record high on Thursday after the Bank of Japan refrained from raising interest rates, in a volatile session that saw the benchmark index flip between gains and losses more than 20 times.

The Nikkei climbed as much as 0.6% to reach 51,620.79 for the first time, before succumbing to some profit taking.

For a full report, click on

COMMODITIES

GOLD - Gold prices rose 2% on Thursday, buoyed by a Federal Reserve interest rate cut as well as lingering uncertainty over the outcome of a trade deal between China and the U.S.

Spot gold was up 1.9% at $4,003.62 per ounce as of 01:39 p.m. ET (1739 GMT).

For a full report, click on

- - - -

IRON ORE - Iron ore futures pulled back on Thursday, as a bout of profit-taking took toll after the meeting between leaders of the world's top two economies.

The most-traded January iron ore contract on China's Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) pared some gains to close daytime trade 0.38% higher at 802.5 yuan ($112.66) a metric ton, after hitting a more than one-month high of 810.5 yuan earlier in the session.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

BASE METALS - Copper prices retreated on Thursday from the previous day's record highs on cautious remarks by the Federal Reserve on U.S. interest rate cuts and concern about Chinese physical demand.

Three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange slid 2.6% to $10,893.50 per metric ton by 1715 GMT, after hitting a record high of $11,200 on Wednesday on supply concerns.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

OIL - Oil prices held steady on Thursday as investors assessed a potential trade truce between the United States and China after U.S. President Donald Trump lowered tariffs on China following a meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in South Korea.

Brent futures fell 4 cents, or 0.1%, to $64.88 a barrel at 11:28 a.m. EDT (1528 GMT).

For a full report, click on

- - - -

PALM OIL - Malaysian palm oil futures inched higher on Thursday, tracking strength in Dalian soyoil market while a weakening ringgit added support.

The benchmark palm oil contract for January delivery on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange was up 0.19% at 4,260 ringgit ($1,008.52) a metric ton at closing.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

RUBBER - Japanese rubber futures dipped on Thursday, as concerns over a deepening semiconductor shortage and slowing electric vehicle demand weighed on the auto industry.

The Osaka Exchange (OSE) rubber contract for April delivery , was down 1.5 yen, or 0.48%, at 313.4 yen($2.08) per kg.

For a full report, click on

- - - -

data.title: Pomerantz LLP Advises Shareholders of Class Action Filing Involving Tronox Holdings Plc â€“ TROX
data.description:
NEW YORK CITY, NY / ACCESS Newswire / October 30, 2025 / Pomerantz LLP announces that a class action lawsuit has been filed against Tronox Holdings Plc ("Tronox" or the "Company") . Such investors are advised to contact Danielle Peyton at newaction@pomlaw.com or 646-581-9980, (or 888.4-POMLAW), toll-free, Ext. 7980. Those who inquire by e-mail are encouraged to include their mailing address, telephone number, and the number of shares purchased.

The class action concerns whether Tronox and certain of its officers and/or directors have engaged in securities fraud or other unlawful business practices.

You have until November 3, 2025 to ask the Court to appoint you as Lead Plaintiff for the class if you purchased or otherwise acquired Tronox securities during the Class Period. A copy of the Complaint can be obtained at www.pomerantzlaw.com.

[Click here for information about joining the class action]

On July 30, 2025, Tronox announced its financial results for the second quarter of fiscal 2025, revealing a significant reduction in sales of the Company's TiO2 products for the quarter. The Company attributed the decline to "softer than anticipated coatings season and heightened competitive dynamics." As a result of the setback in sales, Tronox revised its 2025 financial outlook, lowering its full-year revenue guidance and reducing its dividend by 60%.

On this news, Tronox's stock price fell $1.95 per share, or 37.94%, to close at $3.19 per share on July 31, 2025.

Pomerantz LLP, with offices in New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, London, Paris, and Tel Aviv, is acknowledged as one of the premier firms in the areas of corporate, securities, and antitrust class litigation. Founded by the late Abraham L. Pomerantz, known as the dean of the class action bar, Pomerantz pioneered the field of securities class actions. Today, more than 85 years later, Pomerantz continues in the tradition he established, fighting for the rights of the victims of securities fraud, breaches of fiduciary duty, and corporate misconduct. The Firm has recovered numerous multimillion-dollar damages awards on behalf of class members. See www.pomlaw.com.

Attorney advertising. Prior results do not guarantee similar outcomes.

SOURCE: Pomerantz LLP

View the original press release on ACCESS Newswire

data.title: Sugar prices hit five-year lows as surplus forecasts swirl
data.description:
World sugar prices hit five-year lows for a fourth consecutive day on Thursday as worries over a growing surplus prevailed and oil prices headed lower, with investors assessing news of a U.S.-China trade truce.

Raw sugar futures on the ICE exchange , used as a benchmark for pricing physical sugar around the world, â€‹settled down 0.14 cent, or 1%, at 14.28 cents per lb, having earlier hit their lowest since October 2020 at 14.07.

White sugar futures fell 0.9% to $414.00 a metric ton, after touching their lowest since December 2020 at $410 a ton.

Independent sugar analyst Michael McDougall noted that weather forecasts in key sugar-producing regions are still benign, boosting crop prospects, while oil prices remain under pressure amid a lack of details in the U.S.-China trade deal.

He added, however, that sugar prices remain two to three cents below the ethanol parity in Brazil, meaning the overall signal to Brazil cane mills is to produce less sugar and more ethanol.

"The trend is lower and some are now talking about 10-13 cents, but when too many look further down, that is a preliminary signal that we won't see that," McDougall said.

Reinforcing surplus views, earlier data showed sugar production in top producer Brazil grew more than expected in the first half of October, rising 1.25% versus an expected 0.6% increase. But mills reduced the amount of cane they are allocating to sugar, increasing ethanol production.

The data came after Brazil-based consultancy Datagro last week forecast that global sugar will flip into a surplus of 1.98 million tons in 2025/26 from a 5 million-ton deficit.

Limiting losses in sugar, however, India's Uttar Pradesh state has raised the sugarcane price that mills must pay for the new crop by 8.1%, a move that should make it more difficult to export sugar.

In other soft commodities traded, arabica coffee settled up 1.3 cents, or 0.3%, at $3.92 per lb, while robusta coffee rose 0.7% to $4,641 a ton.

London cocoa rose 0.4% to 4,374 pounds per ton, while New York cocoa gained 0.2%, to $6,058 a ton.

data.title: Invitation Homes Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Invitation Homes Inc., a leading provider of single-family homes for lease in the United States, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial growth and operational achievements, underscoring the company's robust performance in the single-family residential property market.

Financial Highlights

Total Revenues: Invitation Homes Inc. reported total revenues of $688.2 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, marking an increase from $660.3 million in the same period in 2024. This growth was primarily driven by higher rental revenues and management fee revenues.

Net Income: The company achieved a net income of $137.2 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $95.6 million in the same period in 2024, indicating improved profitability.

Net Income Per Common Share â€” Basic: Net income per common share (basic) was $0.22 for the three months ended September 30, 2025, up from $0.16 in the same period in 2024, reflecting higher earnings per share.

Net Income Per Common Share â€” Diluted: Net income per common share (diluted) was $0.22 for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $0.15 in the same period in 2024, showing an increase in diluted earnings per share.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: The primary sources of revenue for Invitation Homes Inc. were rental revenues and other property income, with management fee revenues also contributing significantly. Management fee revenues increased from $18,980 in Q3 2024 to $21,975 in Q3 2025, indicating growth in the property management segment.

Geographical Performance: The company operates in various regions, including the Western United States, Southeast United States, Florida, and Texas. Joint ventures such as the 2020 Rockpoint JV and Upward America JV own homes in these markets, contributing to the company's diversified geographical presence.

Sales Units: As of September 30, 2025, Invitation Homes Inc. wholly owns 86,139 homes for lease and jointly owns 7,897 homes for lease. Additionally, the company provides management services for 16,151 homes, indicating a substantial portfolio of managed properties.

Future Outlook: The company is focused on maintaining its position in the single-family residential property market, with plans to continue leveraging its joint ventures and management services to drive growth. The management anticipates that ongoing economic conditions, including interest rates and inflation, may impact future operations, but remains committed to navigating these challenges effectively.

SEC Filing: Invitation Homes Inc. [ INVH ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: HERSHEY CO SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
The Hershey Company, a leading global confectionery and snack manufacturer, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial performance, operational achievements, and strategic initiatives aimed at driving future growth. This summary provides an overview of the key financial and business highlights from the report.

Financial Highlights

  • Net sales: $3,181 million, reflecting a year-over-year increase driven by strong performance in North America Confectionery and Salty Snacks segments.
  • Gross profit: $1,037 million, impacted by higher cost of sales due to increased commodity prices.
  • Operating profit: $435 million, decreased from the prior year due to increased business realignment costs and higher unallocated corporate expenses.
  • Net income: $276 million, a decline from the previous year primarily due to increased interest expense and other net expenses.
  • Net income per shareâ€”diluted: $1.36, reflecting the impact of lower net income and higher interest expenses.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments:
    • The North America Confectionery segment reported net sales of $2,615,600 for the three months ended September 28, 2025, and $7,001,208 for the nine months ended September 28, 2025.
    • The North America Salty Snacks segment achieved net sales of $321,020 for the three months ended September 28, 2025, and $914,337 for the nine months ended September 28, 2025.
    • The International segment recorded net sales of $244,798 for the three months ended September 28, 2025, and $686,010 for the nine months ended September 28, 2025.
  • Geographical Performance:
    • The United States market contributed significantly to the company's performance, with net sales of $2,799,716 for the three months ended September 28, 2025, and $7,552,700 for the nine months ended September 28, 2025.
    • Other countries accounted for $381,702 in net sales for the three months ended September 28, 2025, and $1,048,855 for the nine months ended September 28, 2025.
  • New Product Launches: The company completed the acquisition of the Sour Strips brand from Actual Candy, LLC, an emerging sour candy brand available in a wide range of food distribution channels in the United States. This acquisition is expected to enhance the North America Confectionery segment.
  • Business Realignment Activities: The Advancing Agility & Automation Initiative (AAA Initiative) is underway, aiming to improve supply chain and manufacturing-related spend, optimize selling, general and administrative expenses, and leverage new technology. The initiative is expected to result in total pre-tax costs of $200,000 to $250,000 from inception through 2026, with ongoing annual savings of approximately $400,000 anticipated by the conclusion of the program.
  • Future Outlook: The company is focused on completing the acquisition of LesserEvil, LLC, a producer of organic popcorn and puffed snack products, by the end of 2025. This acquisition is expected to complement Hersheyâ€™s existing product portfolio and will be financed with cash on hand and short-term borrowings.

SEC Filing: HERSHEY CO [ HSY ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: DT Midstream, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
DT Midstream, Inc., a leading provider of natural gas transportation and storage services, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial growth and robust operational performance, driven by strategic acquisitions and new contracts. The company continues to leverage its extensive pipeline and gathering systems to capitalize on market opportunities and deliver value to its shareholders.

Financial Highlights

  • Operating Revenues: $314 million, increased from $248 million in the prior year period, driven by the Midwest Pipeline Acquisition and new contracts.
  • Operating Income: $155 million, up from $122 million in the prior year period, reflecting higher revenues and controlled operating expenses.
  • Net Income Attributable to DT Midstream: $115 million, compared to $88 million in the prior year period, benefiting from increased operating income.
  • Basic Earnings per Common Share: $1.14, up from $0.91 in the prior year period, reflecting higher net income.
  • Diluted Earnings per Common Share: $1.13, compared to $0.90 in the prior year period, indicating improved profitability.

Business Highlights

  • Pipeline Segment Performance: The Pipeline segment, which includes interstate and intrastate pipelines, storage systems, and gathering lateral pipelines, reported an increase in operating revenues for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, primarily due to the Midwest Pipeline Acquisition and new contracts. However, there was a slight decrease in operating revenues for the three months ended September 30, 2025, due to lower volumes on Stonewall and reduced short-term contract revenues.
  • Gathering Segment Performance: The Gathering segment, which includes gathering systems and related facilities, saw an increase in operating revenues for both the three and nine months ended September 30, 2025. This was driven by higher volumes at Blue Union Gathering and operations at Ohio Utica Gathering, despite lower volumes at Susquehanna and Appalachia Gatherings.
  • Operational Expenses: Operation and maintenance expenses increased significantly in both segments due to the Midwest Pipeline Acquisition and higher production-related expenses, particularly in the Gathering segment. Depreciation and amortization expenses also rose due to new assets placed in service.
  • Equity Method Investees: Earnings from equity method investees in the Pipeline segment showed mixed results, with a slight increase for the three months ended September 30, 2025, but a decrease for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, due to higher interest expenses and maintenance costs.
  • Future Outlook - Pipeline: The company plans to leverage its long-term agreements and strategic asset locations to pursue growth opportunities, including expansions on existing assets and new contracts at storage complexes.
  • Future Outlook - Gathering: The Gathering segment is expected to benefit from long-term agreements and high-quality reserves, with plans for further expansions at key gathering sites to drive future growth.
  • Environmental and Regulatory Compliance: The company continues to comply with environmental regulations and anticipates potential impacts from future legislation, which could affect operational costs and capital expenditures.
  • Capital Investments: The company is focused on disciplined capital deployment, with significant investments planned for expansions in both the Pipeline and Gathering segments, aiming for a total capital expenditure of approximately $445 million to $485 million for the year ending December 31, 2025.

SEC Filing: DT Midstream, Inc. [ DTM ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: AMETEK INC/ SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
AMETEK INC/, a leading global manufacturer of electronic instruments and electromechanical devices, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant growth in both financial and operational metrics, driven by strong sales performance, strategic acquisitions, and effective cost management. The company continues to benefit from its Operational Excellence initiatives and remains focused on integrating recent acquisitions while navigating global market challenges.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Sales: $1,892.6 million, an increase of 10.8% compared with the third quarter of 2024, driven by a 4% increase in organic sales, a 6% increase from acquisitions, and a 1% favorable effect of foreign currency translation.
  • Cost of Sales: $1,206.5 million, representing 63.7% of net sales, an increase of 10.4% compared with the third quarter of 2024, primarily due to the net sales increase.
  • Operating Income: $488.4 million, an increase of 9.5% compared with the third quarter of 2024, with operating margins negatively impacted by recent acquisitions and acquisition-related costs.
  • Net Income: $371.4 million, an increase of 9.2% compared with the third quarter of 2024, reflecting strong sales performance and operational efficiency.
  • Diluted Earnings Per Share: $1.60, an increase of 8.8% compared with the third quarter of 2024, supported by higher net income and effective cost management.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The Electronic Instruments Group (EIG) reported net sales of $1,246.3 million for Q3 2025, a 9.8% increase from Q3 2024, driven by a 9% increase from recent acquisitions and a 1% favorable effect of foreign currency translation. The Electromechanical Group (EMG) achieved net sales of $646.3 million, marking a 12.6% increase, primarily due to a 12% organic sales increase and a 1% favorable effect of foreign currency translation.
  • Geographical Performance: International sales for Q3 2025 were $906.1 million, representing 47.9% of net sales, an 11.4% increase from Q3 2024. This growth was mainly due to higher demand in Europe and contributions from recent acquisitions, although it was partially offset by lower demand in Asia.
  • Sales Units: The company reported record orders of $1,967.8 million for Q3 2025, a 12.9% increase from Q3 2024, with a 7% increase in organic orders and a 7% increase from acquisitions.
  • Operational Excellence Initiatives: The company continued to benefit from its Operational Excellence initiatives, which contributed to improved operating margins despite the dilutive impact of recent acquisitions and acquisition-related costs.
  • Future Outlook: The company is actively monitoring the impact of tariffs and trade restrictions, implementing strategic adjustments to its global supply chains, and leveraging its worldwide manufacturing footprint to mitigate potential adverse effects. The company remains focused on integrating recent acquisitions and expects continued benefits from its Operational Excellence initiatives.

SEC Filing: AMETEK INC/ [ AME ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: SATS ASA: SATSâ€™ share buyback program has been completed
data.description:
Reference is made to the stock exchange announcement made by SATS ASA ("SATS" or the "Company") on 8 May 2025 of the launch of SATSâ€™ program to repurchase up to 2,500,000 of the Companyâ€™s shares in open market transactions for a total amount of up to NOK 100 million during the period from 9 May 2025, until no later than the Company's Annual General Meeting of 2026, pursuant to an agreement with DNB Carnegie (the "Buyback Program").

SATS has now completed the share buyback program. A total of 2,449,430 shares, which equals 1.23% of the shares in the company, were purchased on Oslo Stock Exchange, for a total consideration of NOK 91,556,725. The average price paid per share was NOK 36.6310. Following this, SATS owns a total of 4,922,241 own shares.

This announcement contains information that is subject to disclosure requirements pursuant to the Market Abuse Regulation and section 5-12 of the Norwegian Securities Trading Act.

data.title: GE Hlthcr Techs Is Maintained at Equal-Weight by Morgan Stanley
Corn and Wheat Sink on Non-Mention in U.S.-China Trade Truce â€” Market Talk
data.description: News about the agricultural portion of the U.S.-China trade truce mentions that China will resume buying U.S. soybean exports. But there doesn't appear to be any mention of U.S. corn or wheat, which is pressuring those CBOT futures contracts today. "Corn and wheat not only were left out of the trade agreement, but also have a negative seasonal tendency beginning in early November," says Brian Hoops of Midwest Market Solutions. "Without news from the trade agreement, positive fundamental information is lacking for corn and even more so for wheat." Wheat is down 1.6%, while corn sinks 1%. Soybeans are up 1.1%. (kirk.maltais@wsj.com)

data.title: Digitalage Files Breakthrough Patent for Hardware-Accelerated AI System That Redefines Real-Time Credibility and Media Verification
data.description:
New 'hardware-accelerated truth verification' system designed to combat real-time misinformation and challenge Big Tech's 30% app store 'toll roads'.

TEMECULA, CALIFORNIA / ACCESS Newswire / October 30, 2025 / Hop-on, Inc. Digitalage, the next-generation social media and AI company founded by Peter Michaels, today announced the filing of a U.S. Provisional Patent Application (No. 63/908,082) titled "A System, Method, and Apparatus for Hardware-Accelerated, Multi-Modal Credibility Analysis with Dynamic Calibration and Continual Learning."

This filing establishes a foundational patent in hardware-accelerated truth verification - a system capable of analyzing text, video, audio, and images simultaneously, in real time, with sub-20 millisecond latency.

The invention introduces Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) and dedicated Neural Processing Units (NPUs) purpose-built for credibility analysis, bridging AI explainability with instant decision intelligence, something never before achieved in large-scale content verification.

A Major Leap Beyond Microsoft's Myslinski Patent Portfolio

Microsoft's Myslinski patents dominated early credibility and multimodal analysis research, defining a decade of machine-verification architecture.

Digitalage's new patent surpasses those limitations, introducing a hardware-software co-optimized architecture that outperforms prior benchmarks in both accuracy and latency, achieving:

  • 56.5% claim-verification accuracy on FEVER (a 24.63% lift over current benchmarks)

  • 4Ã— throughput and >4.25Ã— lower latency on ASIC-accelerated hardware

  • Continual learning loops that self-calibrate against deepfake and misinformation models without retraining from scratch

This architecture empowers real-time, explainable AI systems that can verify claims and identify manipulated media faster than misinformation can spread.

Context: Escaping Big Tech's 30% Toll Roads

Big Tech platforms like Apple and Google still charge up to 30% on all digital transactions through their app stores, a structural tax that suppresses innovation and limits profitability for emerging tech platforms and creators.

Apple App Store

â€¢ 30% on paid app downloads & in-app purchases (AppleInsider + App Radar)

â€¢ Subscriptions drop to 15% after year one (AppleInsider)

â€¢ Small Business Program: 15% if annual revenue â‰¤ US $1M (Apple Developer)

â€¢ Under the EU DMA, Apple is testing lower tiers & alternate payments (Reuters)

Google Play Store

â€¢ 30% on digital goods via Play Billing (TMS + Medianama)

â€¢ Reduced Service Fee: 15% if revenue â‰¤ US $1M (Apphud)

â€¢ "User choice billing" may cut to ~26% in some regions (Medianama)

These fees apply to digital goods, not physical products, and remain one of the most prohibitive barriers for social platforms and independent creators.

Digitalage's patent portfolio and distributed architecture give it the leverage to bypass or negotiate better terms with app store operators and licensing partners, paving the way for direct distribution, revenue efficiency, and IP licensing at the infrastructure level.

Peter Michaels, Founder and Lead Inventor, stated:

"We didn't just build a faster system, we built a smarter one.

This patent is a strategic weapon for truth, transparency, and monetization. It protects our ability to verify content faster than misinformation spreads, while ensuring creators and partners aren't forced to pay 30% to access their own audiences."

Strategic Implications

This patent filing strengthens Digitalage's global IP portfolio, supporting multiple commercialization paths:

  • Licensing to AI infrastructure providers (NVIDIA, Qualcomm, Intel, AMD)

  • Integration into verification systems for news, government, and financial institutions

  • Partnerships with app platforms under new EU Digital Markets Act frameworks

  • Deployment within Digitalage's own decentralized platform for verified social media and media rights protection

About Hop-on, Inc. Hop-on, Inc. is a US-based international leader in the development and manufacture of electronics, distributed software, and telecommunications hardware and services. Since 1993, the Company has had a proven record of innovation, from developing the world's first CDMA disposable cell phone to the upcoming Digitalage decentralized social media platform, which promotes data portability, free speech, and essential tools for content protection and royalty management. www.hop-on.comwww.twitter.com/hpnn

About Digitalage Digitalage is revolutionizing the creator economy by combatting content piracy and empowering publishers, influencers, and contributors. The platform leverages decentralized Web3 technologies to enable users to connect, create, and share content while ensuring rights holders are fairly compensated for their intellectual property. www.digitalage.com

Forward-Looking Statements This press release contains forward-looking statements regarding Hop-on's operational initiatives and the planned launch of Digitalage. These statements are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially. Hop-on undertakes no obligation to update forward-looking statements except as required by law. For more information, please visit https://www.hop-on.com/forward-looking-statements.

Investor and Media Contact Hop-on, Inc. 949-756-9008

SOURCE: Hop-on, Inc.

The following document constitutes the final terms dated October 28, 2025Â (the "Final Terms"), relating to the admission to trading of the Covered Bonds with effect fromÂ October 30, 2025 for purpose ofÂ Article 8 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1129Â and as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 (EUWA). Terms used in the Final Terms shall be deemed to be defined as such for purposes of the Conditions (the "Conditions") set forth in the prospectus datedÂ July 9, 2025,Â as supplemented by the first supplementary prospectus dated August 28, 2025,Â which together constitute a base prospectus (the "Prospectus").Â  Full information on Royal Bank of Canada and the offer of the Covered Bonds is only available on the basis of the combination of the Final Terms and the Prospectus.

In particular, theÂ Covered BondsÂ and the related Covered Bond GuaranteeÂ have not been and will not be registered under the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act") or the securities laws of any state of the United States.Â  Accordingly, theÂ Covered Bonds may be resoldÂ only (i)Â inÂ offshore transactions to non-U.S. persons in reliance upon Regulation S under the Securities ActÂ orÂ (ii)Â to qualified institutional buyers in reliance upon Rule 144A under the Securities Act.Â

data.title: Guardant Health Is Maintained at Buy by Citigroup
GE Vernova Is Maintained at Overweight by Morgan Stanley
Brazilian Real Losses Ground
data.description:
The Brazilian real weakened past 5.37 per US dollar, amid a strong US dollar offsetting trade developments.

Externally, a firmer US dollar driven by lingering expectations that the Federal Reserve may hold rates higher for longer is pressuring the real, while the recent USâ€“China trade truce has offered limited relief.

Despite tariff reductions and the suspension of rare-earth export controls, the agreement is largely seen as temporary and maintaining the status quo, leaving uncertainty over global trade flows and Brazilâ€™s export outlook.

Domestically, although the Central Bank of Brazil has maintained a hawkish stance with high policy rates, inflationary pressures remain contained, limiting further yield support for the currency.

Additionally, external risks such as ongoing trade and tariff frictions, combined with elevated fiscal uncertainty and a reliance on commodity exports, are sustaining a cautious environment.

data.title: Valero Reports Power Outage at Corpus Christi West Refinery: Filing â€” OPIS
data.description:
Valero on Tuesday into Wednesday reported emissions at the west plant of its 301,000 b/d Corpus Christi, Texas, refinery due to a power outage, according to a Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) filing.

"A power disruption caused by an off-site power provider resulted in the loss of electrical power in the West Plant," the report stated. "As a result, protective safety shutdown sequences were automatically initiated, including venting of process gases to facility flares."

The emissions event started at 11:55 p.m. on Tuesday and concluded at 9:30 a.m. on Wednesday, the filing noted.

A Valero spokesperson was not available for comment by the time of publication.

This content was created by Oil Price Information Service, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. OPIS is run independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

  • Reporting by Andrew Atwal, aatwal@opsinet.com; Editing by My Nguyen, mynguyen@opisnet.com

data.title: New York to Sell $115.5M in Bonds for Buffalo Housing Project
data.description:
By Paulo Trevisani

The New York State Housing Finance Agency plans to issue $115.5 million of bonds to finance a multi-family rental housing project in Buffalo.

Proceeds from the Affordable Housing Revenue Bonds 2025 Series E will fund a project expected to meet energy efficiency and green building standards, leading the agency to designate the securities as sustainability bonds, according to a document posted Wednesday on MuniOS.

Money raised from the sale will fund a mortgage loan for Marine Drive Apartments, a new 254-unit affordable housing development in Erie County. All units are destined for low-income households. The project will consist of three apartment buildings and one parking garage. Construction is expected to take 42 months.

The securities are exempt from federal income tax and New York State personal income tax. The bonds mature Nov. 1, 2065, and are subject to mandatory tender on May 1, 2030, at the option of the agency.

The bonds are payable from the revenue and other funds originated by the program, including payments from the mortgage loans.

Moody's assigned the bonds a rating of Aa2.

JP Morgan is the lead underwriter.

Write to Paulo Trevisani at paulo.trevisani@wsj.com

data.title: Nasdaq Falls After Meta, Microsoft Earnings; U.S. Agrees to Cut China Tariffs â€” WSJ
data.description:
By Joe Wallace

The stock-market rally paused Thursday, as post-earnings downturns in Meta Platforms and Microsoft shares weighed on indexes.

Investors gave a thumbs down to Meta's plans to spend even more to stay in the artificial-intelligence race, sending shares sliding about 10%. Yields on Meta's bonds jumped after the company said it was looking to raise at least $25 billion from a jumbo debt sale.

The dollar and Treasury yields extended Wednesday's gains. Traders pared bets on an interest-rate cut in December after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said one was far from a done deal.

Meantime, the world's most important trading relationship is in the spotlight. After the first face-to-face meeting between Presidents Trump and Xi Jinping in six years, the U.S. said that it would cut tariffs on China and that Beijing was set to ease restrictions on rare-earth elements and crack down on exports of chemicals used to make fentanyl.

Stock markets rallied earlier this week in anticipation of a breakthrough in trade talks. But the actual numbers agreed were modest, and industry watchers said China appears set to maintain the rare-earth curbs introduced in the spring. Businesses meanwhile are hunkering down for more rocky times ahead for U.S.-China commerce.

More big tech earnings are due later today, with results expected from Apple and Amazon. The combined market value of the Magnificent Seven stood yesterday at 38% of the S&P 500, the highest proportion in data going back to 2020.

In recent trading:

Dow industrials rose, while the broader S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite indexes fell.

The yen weakened after the Bank of Japan held interest rates steady. Japan's Nikkei 225 closed at a record high and notched its largest one-month percentage gain in nearly five years.

Stocks declined in China and Europe. The European Central Bank also held rates.

This item is part of a Wall Street Journal live coverage event. The full stream can be found by searching P/WSJL (WSJ Live Coverage).

data.title: Mastercard cheers healthy consumer spending and new opportunities in AI shopping
data.description:
By Emily Bary

Economic cracks don't seem to be stopping the card networks from registering sustained spending growth

Mastercard reported upbeat results on Thursday.

Wall Street got another positive read early Thursday on the health of the consumer when Mastercard Inc. gave an upbeat sales forecast on the heels of sustained spending growth.

In looking to the fourth quarter, Mastercard (MA) expects revenue growth at a high-teens rate relative to a year before. Analysts tracked by FactSet were expecting $8.71 billion in revenue, which would translate to about 16% growth.

That comes after Chief Executive Michael Miebach used Mastercard's earnings release to call out robust spending from both consumers and businesses, which helped the company post 9% growth in gross dollar volume for its third quarter and 10% growth in purchase volume. Those both matched rates seen in the second quarter.

"Across different segments of the population, whether it's affluent or mass market, we're seeing good healthy trends," Chief Financial Officer Sachin Mehra added in a conversation with MarketWatch.

Visa Inc. (V) also pointed to consumer "resilience" when it delivered its numbers earlier this week. On Visa's earnings call, executives highlighted "relatively consistent" growth among different income bands, "with the highest-spend band continuing to grow the fastest."

Read: Visa earnings offer an upbeat read on consumer-spending habits

That Visa and Mastercard are humming along while cracks show up in some pockets of the economy underscores the high-level nature of these businesses. As Visa pointed out earlier this week, the company is broadly exposed to debit and credit trends; so is Mastercard. That means the companies are relatively insulated from trends like consumers trading down to lower-priced products, as long as customers keep spending in aggregate.

Consumers "might make choices as to how they spend, but the size of the wallet that they're spending is what we get to see," Mastercard's Mehra said.

Don't miss: Fiserv's stock plunges 40% on worst day ever. Outlook reset is deemed 'difficult to comprehend.'

For the third quarter, that spending helped drive $8.6 billion in revenue for Mastercard, a hair above the FactSet analyst consensus of $8.54 billion. Adjusted earnings per share came in at $4.38, while analysts had been modeling $4.32.

Mastercard benefits from its faster-growth services business that consists of fraud products, research insights and other value-add offerings for financial-services customers. Services revenue was up 25% in the third quarter, outpacing the 17% revenue growth seen for the overall business.

Artificial intelligence could be a further tailwind to the services business, and to Mastercard's spending-related revenue. The company offers tools for agentic commerce, through which AI agents can make purchases on behalf of consumers. From a services perspective, there are opportunities to sell merchants and financial partners on tools for authentication, loyalty and other areas that they might want when rolling out AI commerce offerings.

Meanwhile, Mehra thinks AI agents could help spur more transactions, which is good for Mastercard since the company generates revenue related to both the dollar value of transactions and the number of transactions.

He explained that a consumer who is buying shoes and who also needs socks might buy them both from the same place to save time - but an AI agent might shop around and buy the items from two different places.

"What we will see is that the dollar value of spend might be the same across me buying a shoe and the socks, but you might get two transactions opposed to one," Mehra said.

Read on: American Express sees credit-card spending accelerate

-Emily Bary

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.
